title: Lead BI Analyst, Quality Assurance (Remote)
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

This position prioritizes and drives a wide variety of data science projects that will focus on providing senior leadership with the metrics and analysis they need to make strategic and tactical decisions in a timely manner.


Manages the Quality BI platform. Develops and implements multi-faceted solutions for complex quality and business challenges—ranging from post market customer experience optimization to internal segmentation of quality measurements, targeting improvements and business strategies.


Identifies key areas of improvement and uses appropriate analysis to drive new projects into development. Works collaboratively with business and technical partners to rapidly advance projects from early ideation to value-creating solutions in production. 


Is highly versatile, blending the roles of a data scientist and data engineer, with responsibilities including exploratory data wrangling, data analysis, data modeling, data pipelining, and dashboarding. Is comfortable working in a leadership position. Is focused on achieving business objectives using data science while being flexible in the areas of pursuit. Able to effectively collaborate & communicate with non-technical business colleagues.


Primary Responsibilities:


  • Serve as Quality Core team member supporting analytics reporting for post market surveillance, new product introductions, sustaining engineering programs and global quality operations
  • Build descriptive, predictive and prescriptive models using Big Data, statistics, machine learning across various themes
  • Develop, harmonize and define corporate KPIs to help leaders make strategic decisions based on current business environments
  • Identify new data sources that can be used to enhance business outcomes
  • Lead NuVasive quality analytics development and reporting
  • Drive cost of quality program (CoQ)
  • Educate Quality leaders and practitioners on modeling complex problems, discovering insights, and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, data mining, and visualization techniques
  • Assist, grow, and democratize the NuVasive data scientist community with new data collection processes to minimize “hands-on” time & reduce collection errors
  • Provide on-going tracking and monitoring on the performance of decision systems and statistical models
  • Identify other data sources as needed and how to integrate them within the existing business framework
Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Experience building end-to-end solutions
  • Experience with manufacturing use cases such as process optimization and predictive maintenance
  • Fluency with global secondary data systems
  • Knowledge of querying languages, with expertise in at least one (e.g. SQL)
  • Expertise in at least 1 data-oriented programming language (e.g. Python, R, etc.)
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI)
  • Able to lead and drive a self-directed organization.
  • Strong communication experience with multi-disciplinary teams
Education and Experience

  • Typically requires a minimum of 8 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 6 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 3 years experience; or equivalent experience
  • Degree in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science or related discipline preferred
Travel and/or Physical Requirements
  • Preferred work location considerations: CA, Denver, Memphis, Dayton, New Jersey would be ideal as well
  • Remote US-based is acceptable for the right candidate
#LI-Remote
#LI-remote #CL-1

For roles based in the United States that require access to hospital facilities, must be eligible for and maintain credentials at all required hospitals, including meeting any applicable physical requirements or vaccination requirements (including the COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable).



NuVasive is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. The “EEO is the Law” poster options are available here. NuVasive's EEO policy is available here. 
 
About NuVasive
NuVasive, Inc. (NASDAQ: NUVA) is the leader in spine technology innovation, with a mission to transform surgery, advance care, and change lives. The Company's less-invasive, procedurally integrated surgical solutions are designed to deliver reproducible and clinically proven outcomes. The Company's comprehensive procedural portfolio includes surgical access instruments, spinal implants, fixation systems, biologics, software for surgical planning, navigation and imaging solutions, magnetically adjustable implant systems for spine and orthopedics, and intraoperative neuromonitoring technology and service offerings. With more than $1 billion in net sales, NuVasive has approximately 2,700 employees and operates in more than 50 countries serving surgeons, hospitals, and patients. For more information, please visit www.nuvasive.com.

title: Sales Associate (Kansas City, MO)
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities
NuVasive is an innovative medical device company focused on developing minimally disruptive surgical products and procedurally integrated solutions for the spine. The Company is the 3rd largest player in the $8.2 billion global spine market. With a focus on Speed of Innovation®, Absolute Responsiveness®, and Superior Clinical Outcomes, we are revolutionizing how spine procedures are performed on patients around the world.

Why should you join NuVasive?
Over $1.2 B in 2020 revenue, we are continuing to climb at 7% revenue growth with a presence in over 50 countries and 2700 employees. This is THE place to start a career, to accelerate your careers, and have a larger relative impact than anywhere else you have worked.

Why should you join the Sales team?
As NuVasive continues to grow, we need top sales rock stars to achieve the revenue and product mix requirements for their territories. Join a team that works with top surgeons to provide innovative solutions to back pain and spine surgery.

The Sales Associate is responsible for selling the company's implantable medical devices to hospitals, clinics, and physicians as appropriate. Provides support, training and/or guidance during actual procedures or surgeries.

Primary Responsibilities


  • Develops the required technical, clinical and sales competencies through the completion of the sales associate development program in order to qualify and meet the expectations for advancement
  • Provides coordination and logistic support in properly ordering, transporting, setting up and reassembling surgical instrument sets inside sterile processing departments at hospitals and surgery centers
  • Acts as a product support consultant to surgeons and operating room staff during surgical procedures in the safe and proper use of proprietary products and related surgical techniques
  • Supports and contributes to the growth of revenues in assigned Sales Specialists territories through delegated business development activities with surgeons, hospitals and related staff
  • Works extended, off normal work hours with flexibility in being able to adjust personal schedule
  • Performs other duties as assigned
 
Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Must be able to provide after hours and weekend case support, as necessary
  • Highly organized with the capacity to prioritize in a deadline-oriented environment
  • Knowledge of utilizing computers/tablets with familiarity to work in customer relationship management tools and the Microsoft suite of products
  • Competency to learn and effectively articulate technical product knowledge and medical terminology in discussions with customers
  • Proactive mindset with the dexterity to quickly make sense of complex issues while managing multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Be qualified for and maintain privileges at all required hospitals, including meeting any applicable physical requirements or vaccination requirements (including the COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable).

Education and Experience
  • Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience; or equivalent work experience
  • Preferred 1+ year in medical device sales 
  • Preferred science and/or technical background or aptitude 
  • Required 2+ years in general business to business sales 

For roles based in the United States that require access to hospital facilities, must be eligible for and maintain credentials at all required hospitals, including meeting any applicable physical requirements or vaccination requirements (including the COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable).

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. title: Neurophysiologist Short-term Traveler (Mountain West)
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities
As a Neurophysiologist at NuVasive Clinical Services, you’ll provide intraoperative neuromonitoring during surgery by monitoring the patient’s nervous system.  A high standard of patient care is essential to our team. This is a great opportunity for you to work with our top surgeons and other medical professionals in a team environment and play a vital role in the operating room every day.  As a member of our team, you will also support NuVasive technological innovations. NuVasive provides comprehensive training, continuing education, and numerous opportunities for career development.
 
Primary Responsibilities:
  • Obtains a detailed medical history on the patient and consults with the surgeon regarding patient structures at risk and modalities to be monitored 
  • Communicates monitoring information to the surgeon and the surgical team throughout the case 
  • Displays and labels waveforms for marking, measuring and calculating information such as latencies, amplitudes and conduction times following established guidelines and protocols 
  • Identifies appropriate protocols and performs troubleshooting techniques to assure accurate data collection 
  • Completes all required documentation and accurately prepares all IOM logs, files, and timely file uploads 
  • Maintains all neuromonitoring equipment and conduct required maintenance checks 
  • Performs other duties as assigned
Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Ability to transport and set up equipment totaling 50lbs in a timely fashion in the operating room including IONM system, laptop, and supplies 
  • Strong time management & organizational skills, and ability to manage competing demands, frequent change, delays and/or unexpected events in scheduling and in the operating room on a daily basis
  • Strong time management & organizational skills, and ability to manage competing demands, frequent change, delays and/or unexpected events in scheduling and in the operating room on a daily basis 
  • Effective communication skills and proven ability to collaborate in a team-oriented setting including communication in English with surgeons and surgical staff
  • Ability to handle the demands of regular travel 
  • Be qualified for and maintain privileges at all required hospitals, including meeting any applicable physical requirements or vaccination requirements (including COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable).
  • Be eligible for medical malpractice insurance coverage at standard rates, which insurance shall be provided by the Company
  • Obtain and maintain CNIM status
Education and Experience
  • Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience; or equivalent work experience 
  • Certified in Neurophysiologic Intraoperative Monitoring (CNIM) 
  • Operating Room (OR) experience preferred
Travel and/or Physical Requirements
  • Able to travel up to 100%
  • Be qualified for and maintain privileges at all required hospitals, including meeting any applicable physical requirements or vaccination requirements (including COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable).
  • Ability to transport and set up equipment totaling 50lbs in a timely fashion in the operating room including IONM system, laptop, and supplies
  • Ability to bend over to perform certain duties, stand for several periods of time, visual and auditory skills, manual dexterity, wear gloves, masks, gowns, and goggles for extended periods of time
 
 
Please note, you will be redirected to a 15-20 minute assessment after submitting your application. Please ensure you allow yourself enough time to complete the assessment upon submission of your application. 
 
 
NuVasive Clinical Services (a division within NuVasive, Inc.) is a leading provider of intraoperative neuromonitoring (IOM) services to surgeons and healthcare facilities, through the acquisitions of Impulse Monitoring, Biotronic NeuroNetwork, Safe Passage, and others. Surgeons have enhanced surgical monitoring and oversight capabilities through neurophysiological data gathered via broadband transmission. IOM technology gives those in the operating room real-time insight into the nervous system, which can help surgeons reduce surgical risk by providing critical information and alerts throughout the procedure. This neural function monitoring helps to decrease the chance of nerve damage to the patient and promotes patient safety during surgery. NuVasive Clinical Services is expected to serve more than 100,000 cases annually in the U.S. From over 530 highly trained neurophysiologists in the operating room to technicians and scheduling staff available 24/7, NuVasive Clinical Services can help support improved clinical outcomes. 

#LI-remote

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.   • Effective communication skills and proven ability to collaborate in a team-oriented setting including communication in English with surgeons and surgical staff 
  • Ability to handle the demands of regular travel

title: Senior Desktop Support Technician
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

Coordinates, diagnoses, and troubleshoots incoming employee issues. Provides support services to employees with technical problems involving desktop, laptop or network services from local personnel or from employees using network remote access. Provides timely resolution of problems or escalation on behalf of customer to appropriate technical personnel. Provides case status updates to management and end-users. Supports and maintains effective relationships with end users. Documents and maintains standard operating procedures and customer service guidelines relating to IT support.

  • Installs, maintains, and troubleshoots all company mobile devices, network & server equipment, workstations, sounds systems, printers, IP Phones, projectors, and video conferencing systems
  • Administers and resolves issues with associated end-user workstations, networks, and software products
  • Maintains efficient call queue service to quickly and effectively support all customer issues or questions
  • Conducts research on desktop products in support of PC procurement and development efforts, and recommends products for purchase
  • Performs other duties as assigned
Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Intermediate proficiency and knowledge of various versions of MS Office applications
  • Strong customer service and communication skills
  • Great capacity to manage multiple tasks and prioritize projects without compromising work quality
  • Strong interpersonal and written skills, with the ability to explain technical matters in non-technical terms

Education and Experience
  • Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 3 years 
  • Experience with troubleshooting IT issues and supporting help desks preferred

Travel and/or Physical Requirements

  • Must be able to occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds

title: Sr. Human Resources Coordinator
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

This role will be part of the HR Connect shared services team within the Human Resources department. This team drives efficiencies and strives to be a single resource for employees and their HR needs.  This role will not only support employees of the company but will also collaborate with the department in various projects and data maintenance.  The successful candidate will be responsible for providing support for the department, entering a high volume of employment records into our HR database and answering employee HR related questions.  

  • Assist with the onboarding and offboarding of employees by entering new hire information our HR database, collecting and tracking new hire forms, establishing personnel files, preparing exit documents and entering status changes in the HR database
  • Process a variety of other data changes and maintain personnel files
  • Answer employee HR related questions through our electronic tracking system, email, by phone, or in person.
  • Provide HRIS system support to employees and the HR organization
  • Serve as a partner and provide support to assigned Field HR Generalists and Business HR Generalists
  • Ensure accuracy of data change requests through HRIS system
  • Collaborate with Payroll department in support of the time management system and pay updates
  • Assist in identifying process improvements in HR processes
  • Performs other job-related duties to support HR needs as assigned
Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Solid systems skills; including expertise in Human Resources information system(s) and solid understanding of MS Office Suite
  • Excellent communication and customer service skills: experience working across multiple levels, functions, and regions; able to clearly communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Highly organized and detail oriented with an ability to multi-task and adapt in a fast-paced organization 
  • Works well under pressure and meets tight deadlines
  • Integrity: adheres to high moral and ethical standards with the ability to handle confidential information with a high level of discretion
Education and Experience
  • Typically requires a high school diploma and a minimum of 2+ years of related experience or equivalent education and experience
  • Associates or bachelor’s degree preferred

title: Assistente de Logística 1
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

Inicia, mantém e compila registros associados ao pedido, recebimento, armazenamento, emissão e envio de materiais, suprimentos e equipamentos. Embala e prepara produtos e mercadorias para embarque final e lança pesos e despesas de envio. Prepara e mantém registros de mercadorias embarcadas. Analisa os pedidos dos clientes, examina, estoca e distribui mercadorias, produtos e materiais no centro de distribuição.

Compara a nomenclatura, números de estoque e outras informações listadas em guias de remessa para verificar a precisão dos pedidos de compra e pedidos de remessa

· Compila e executa tarefas de entrada de dados para manter estoque, compras, remessas e outros registros; utiliza fontes de dados como contratos, ordens de compra, faturas, requisições, etc.

· Verifica os cálculos de inventário em relação à contagem física de estoque e ajusta erros e discrepâncias de documentos com a ação corretiva proposta

· Compila e mantém registros manuais ou computadorizados, como inventário de materiais, relatórios de produção em processo e status dos locais de materiais

· Compila informações sobre recebimento de desembolso de material, equipamento, mercadoria ou suprimentos e calcula saldo de estoque, preço e custo

· Embala materiais e equipamentos garantindo que a documentação de embarque seja precisa e os materiais estejam protegidos adequadamente para embarque; determina o roteamento e o modo de transporte mais eficientes e econômicos

· Prepara relatórios como saldo de estoque, preço e faltas tomando as ações necessárias para conciliar as discrepâncias em tempo hábil

· Auxilia no desenvolvimento de processos e procedimentos para estoque, recebimento, remessa e responsabilidades administrativas para melhorar custos e eficiências

· Desempenha outras funções atribuídas

Required Skills / Capabilities

Forte proficiência com o software MS Office, software de gerenciamento de documentos e capacidade de navegar na Internet

· Possui habilidades interpessoais e de comunicação (verbal e escrita)

Education and Experience

Normalmente requer um mínimo de 1 - 2 anos de experiência relacionada

· Diploma do ensino médio ou equivalente requerido

Travel and/or Physical Requirements

title: Senior R&D Project Engineer
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

NuVasive is seeking an experienced Mechanical or Biomedical Engineer for our Mechanical Systems Integration team. As a Sr R&D Project Engineer within our team, you will be accountable for the commercialization of medical devices with enhanced features that allow integration with our navigation enabling technology platform to treat spinal pathologies in accordance with US and international regulations. You will be responsible for the development of innovative mechanical solutions to meet patient and surgeon needs from concept to commercialization. This requires leading cross-functional teams, including marketing, purchasing, regulatory, quality, research and testing, manufacturing, etc, to manage the product development process, project timeline, and deliverables to ensure designs are safe and effective for clinical use as well as directly managing and developing mechanical engineers on the team.

 

Essential Responsibilities 

 

  • Manage 1-2 mechanical engineers and related projects to ensure on-time and on-budget commercialization of medical devices.
  • Participate in and guide project planning, design and phase reviews, mechanical design, technical assessments, and design control documentation.
  • Mentor mechanical engineers to elevate overall performance and guide professional development.
  • Work collaboratively with surgeon design and marketing teams to identify unmet clinical needs and distill them into product requirements.
  • Create and interpret advanced mechanical designs using CAD software suitable for subtractive, additive, sheet metal, and injection molding manufacturing methods while applying DFX principles
  • Guide, review, and approve documentation relevant to design control and other applicable internal and regulatory requirements.
  • Review and approve test plans to effectively characterize product performance and establish sufficient design verification and validation test requirements.
  • Review and approve engineering specifications with dimensions and tolerances appropriate for performance and functional requirements
  • Review and approve technical assessments of mechanical design (e.g. FEA, tolerance analysis, testing, etc.)
  • Coordinate with suppliers and procurement teams to manage the production and commercialization process.
  • Ensure compliance with NuVasive’s Quality Management System and applicable US and OUS regulations and standards.
  • Lead or support cadaver labs during surgeon design team evaluations and surgeon education events, including cadaver setup, running a fluoroscopy machine, clean-up, etc.
Required Skills / Capabilities

Basic Qualifications:

  • Proficiency with CAD software (Pro/E, Creo, or SolidWorks), and Microsoft Office suite
  • Strong communication skills (verbal & written) including ability to positively influence all levels of internal cross-functional teams, suppliers, surgeons, and sales teams
  • Expertise in use of project planning tools such as Microsoft Project
  • Ability to work independently, exercise sound judgment, set direction, manage diverse and conflicting priorities in an effective manner, and meet deadlines with minimal guidance from leadership.
  • Ability to read and interpret documents such as drawings, safety rules, company policy and procedure manuals
  • Proficiency in applying concepts of algebra, geometry, trigonometry, calculus, geometric tolerances, and tolerance analysis in addition to ability to solve and interpret problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
  • Proven experience interpreting an extensive variety of technical specifications in mathematical or diagram form and managing several abstract and/or concrete variables
  • Ability to efficiently drive the product development process with cross-functional teams (Supply Chain, Marketing, Quality, Regulatory, Manufacturing, etc.)

    Education and Experience

    Preferred Qualifications:

    • Typically requires a minimum of 8 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 6 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD with 3 years experience; or equivalent experience
    • Bachelor's or advanced degree in Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or related technical discipline
    • Experience with complex mechanical designs preferably in the medical device industry, and ideally in spine
    • Demonstrated understanding of ISO 13485 and Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 21 Part 820.30 Design Controls, or equivalent understanding working in a regulated industry

      Travel and/or Physical Requirements

      Travel up to 25% required. 


      For roles based in the United States that require access to hospital facilities, must be eligible for and maintain credentials at all required hospitals, including meeting any applicable physical requirements or vaccination requirements (including the COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable).

title: Associate Marketing Specialist, International Marketing
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

NuVasive is the largest, global spine-focused company and helps changes the lives of millions of patients suffering from back pain around the world. Driving the brand for a $1B+ medical technology company, the Corporate Marketing, Brand and Communication (CMBC) team supports our vision to change a patient’s life every minute. The Associate Marketing Specialist plays a critical role to support, develop, and execute marketing, brand, and event strategies in partnership with Regional Marketing, Product Marketing, Commercial and other cross-functional teams—ultimately delivering best-in-class marketing and communication programs to help change the future of spine care.

We need a project manager, strategic thinker, strong writer, and collaborative partner who can support the International Marketing Manager with the planning and implementation of impactful marketing programs. This individual will play a critical role in communicating campaign objectives, deliverables, and timelines to internal and external partners, while continually pursuing process improvements. Career experience in project management and marketing will be viewed as a differentiator.

  • Provide general administrative support for the International Marketing Manager and regional partners
  • Maintain project management tools, capture meeting notes, and ensure action items are completed and deadlines are met
  • Partner with cross-functional teams to define promotional activities, create project plans and manage campaigns from start to finish, inclusive of tradeshows, internal events, social media, email marketing, print advertising, digital advertising, presentation development and more
  • Interact with internal and external partners to measure campaign effectiveness, identify new marketing opportunities, prepare regular activity reports, and respond to questions from the marketing organization
  • Liaise with internal partners and external vendors in the creation of marketing collateral translations and other regional needs, while following proper processes
  • Create internal and external marketing content and publish to sales enablement platform (Seismic)
  • Manage list of regional nuances and confirm proper review/approval in production of marketing materials
  • Gain in depth knowledge of standard marketing processes, guidelines, and tools, and reinforce policies in the various regions by providing trainings
  • Act as a brand ambassador for NuVasive, accountable for the consistent application of the brand and visual identity across the globe
  • Solve problems in complicated situations through the application and integration of analytical skills, creativity, and sound judgment
  • Perform other duties as assigned
Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Ability to work from 7:00 a.m.—3:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time
  • Resourceful with excellent organizational, project management and problem-solving skills with the capability to work on multiple campaigns/priorities at a time
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability adapt communication to accommodate audience diversity and to tailor content to fit multiple channels
  • Ability to multi-task while maintaining strong attention to detail and high level of customer service
  • Ability to collaborate with colleagues in multiple time zones while maintaining healthy and sensible time management
  • Maturity to work with minimal supervision, to self-start, to set appropriate priorities, yet can take direction and learn by shadowing
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
Education and Experience
  • Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and no previous professional experience
  • Prefer 1-3 years of related experience
  • Requires relevant work experience in marketing and project management
  • Experience developing social media and email marketing content preferred
  • Experience executing events/tradeshows preferred
  • Experience with international travel and working with international colleagues desired
  • Experience with InDesign and/or Adobe Illustrator and creative development of marketing materials desired
  • Medical device or similar background desired
Travel and/or Physical Requirements
  • Up to 10% travel
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds

title: Associate Material Handler 2nd Shift
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

The Associate Material Handler initiates, maintains, and compiles records associated with ordering, receiving, storing, issuing, and shipping materials, supplies, and equipment by performing the following duties:

  • Compares nomenclature, stock numbers, and other listed information on packing slips to verify the accuracy of purchase orders and shipping orders
  • Compiles data from sources such as contracts, purchase orders, invoices, requisitions, and accounting reports and writes, types, or enters information into computer to maintain inventory, purchasing, shipping, and other records
  • Verifies inventory computations against physical count of stock and adjusts errors and reports documenting reasons for discrepancies with proposed corrective action
  • Compiles and maintains manual or computerized records such as material inventory, in-process production reports, and status of material locations
  • Compiles information on receipt of, disbursement of material, equipment, merchandise, or supplies, and computes inventory balance, price, and cost
  • Prepares reports such as inventory balance, price, and shortages taking necessary actions to reconcile discrepancies in a timely manner
  • Prepare all necessary shipping documentation and ensure that shipments are tracked to destination
  • Package materials and equipment ensuring that shipping documentation is accurate and materials are protected adequately for shipment
  • Determine the most efficient and economical routing and mode of transportation
  • Initiate investigations into causes of misdirected shipments, damage or shortages in shipments or overcharges in freight cost
  • Assist in the development of processes and procedures for inventory, receiving, shipping, and administrative responsibilities resulting in cost and efficiency improvements
  • Perform duties in compliance with applicable FDA and state regulations as well as standards including, but not limited to, ISO 13485
Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Basic proficiency with MS Office software, document management software and ability to navigating the Internet
  • Possesses interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
Education and Experience

  • Typically requires less than 1 year of related experience

  • High School Diploma or equivalent required
Travel and/or Physical Requirements
  • The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds
  • Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

Organizes and maintains financial records such as financial statements and budget performance. Ensures timely reporting of accounting transactions and compliance with relevant procedures and controls. Reviews and interprets financial reporting requirements, rules and regulations. Balances books and prepares profit and loss, cash flow, income and balance sheet statements. Reviews monthly reports of revenues and expenditures for projects. Provides records of assets, liabilities and other financial transactions. Establishes processes and procedures that properly capture, track and report revenue, including deferred revenue, in accordance with the company revenue recognition policy. Reviews, tracks, and manages billing information in the financial systems, ensuring accuracy and compliance with U.S. GAAP and other accounting regulations.

  • Responsible for month-end close functions including preparing journal entries, reconciliations, supporting schedules and analyses
  • Review variances in financial statements and documents explanations for significant items
  • Prepare monthly balance sheet reconciliations ensuring financial records are maintained in compliance with company policy. Review, investigate, and resolve accounting errors, discrepancies, and reconciling items.
  • Analyze month end and quarter end accrual balances to determine appropriate reserves in accordance with GAAP and company policy.
  • Reconcile and maintain the Fixed assets ledger
  • Reconcile and maintain the payroll ledgers and enter payroll journal entries.
  •  Assist with and reconcile inter-company balances
  • Work cross-functionally with individuals across the organization to support month-end close and reporting
  • Assist with internal controls in areas of responsibility
  • Support with preparing schedules for quarterly reviews & annual audits
  •  Identify, develop, and implement process improvement solutions
  • Special projects and create ad-hoc reports and analysis as required.
  • Reports to Accounting Manager'
  • Performs other duties as assigned

Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Strong ability to collaborate cross-functionally with excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Highly organized, accountable, and proactive with exceptional attention to detail
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills with intermediate proficiency in MS Office applications
  • Working knowledge of GAAP and accounting principles


Education and Experience
  • Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 3 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience

title: Neuromonitoring Specialist (Columbus, OH)
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities
ENTRY-LEVEL - FULL TRAINING PROVIDED 
 
As a Neuromonitoring Specialist / Neurophysiologist at NuVasive Clinical Services, you’ll provide intraoperative neuromonitoring during surgery by monitoring the patient’s nervous system.  A high standard of patient care is essential to our team. This is a great opportunity for you to work with our top surgeons and other medical professionals in a team environment and play a vital role in the operating room every day.  As a member of our team, you will also support NuVasive technological innovations. NuVasive provides comprehensive training, continuing education, and numerous opportunities for career development.
 
Primary Responsibilities:
  • Obtains a detailed medical history on the patient and consults with the surgeon regarding patient structures at risk and modalities to be monitored 
  • Communicates monitoring information to the surgeon and the surgical team throughout the case 
  • Displays and labels waveforms for marking, measuring and calculating information such as latencies, amplitudes and conduction times following established guidelines and protocols 
  • Identifies appropriate protocols and performs troubleshooting techniques to assure accurate data collection 
  • Completes all required documentation and accurately prepares all IOM logs, files, and timely file uploads 
  • Maintains all neuromonitoring equipment and conduct required maintenance checks 
  • Performs other duties as assigned 
Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Ability to transport and set up equipment totaling 50lbs in a timely fashion in the operating room including IONM system, laptop, and supplies 
  • Strong time management & organizational skills, and ability to manage competing demands, frequent change, delays and/or unexpected events in scheduling and in the operating room on a daily basis 
  • Effective communication skills and proven ability to collaborate in a team-oriented setting including communication in English with surgeons and surgical staff 
  • Ability to handle the demands of regular travel 
  • Be qualified for and maintain privileges at all required hospitals, including meeting any applicable physical requirements or vaccination requirements (including COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable). 
  • Be eligible for medical malpractice insurance coverage at standard rates, which insurance shall be provided by the Company 
  • Obtain and maintain the CNIM status 
Education and Experience

 

  • Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and no previous professional experience 
  • Must be CNIM eligible via one pathway as defined by the ABRET website (Bachelor's degree, R EEG T or R EP T certification or a graduate of a CAAHEP or NIM IOM program) 
  • Knowledge of Intraoperative neurophysiological monitoring (IONM) and/or human anatomy & physiology and/or technical troubleshooting preferred 
  • Operating Room (OR) experience preferred 
Travel and/or Physical Requirements
  • Able to travel up to 25%
  • Ability to transport and set up equipment totaling 50lbs in a timely fashion in the operating room including IONM system, laptop, and supplies
  • Ability to bend over to perform certain duties, stand for several periods of time, visual and auditory skills, manual dexterity, wear gloves, masks, gowns, and goggles for extended periods of time
 
 
Please note, you will be redirected to a 15-20 minute assessment after submitting your application. Please ensure you allow yourself enough time to complete the assessment upon submission of your application. 
 
 
NuVasive Clinical Services (a division within NuVasive, Inc.) is a leading provider of intraoperative neuromonitoring (IOM) services to surgeons and healthcare facilities, through the acquisitions of Impulse Monitoring, Biotronic NeuroNetwork, Safe Passage, and others. Surgeons have enhanced surgical monitoring and oversight capabilities through neurophysiological data gathered via broadband transmission. IOM technology gives those in the operating room real-time insight into the nervous system, which can help surgeons reduce surgical risk by providing critical information and alerts throughout the procedure. This neural function monitoring helps to decrease the chance of nerve damage to the patient and promotes patient safety during surgery. NuVasive Clinical Services is expected to serve more than 100,000 cases annually in the U.S. From over 530 highly trained neurophysiologists in the operating room to technicians and scheduling staff available 24/7, NuVasive Clinical Services can help support improved clinical outcomes. 

#LI-remote

title: Field Logistics Specialist (Dallas, TX)
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

The Field Services Representative position is part of the Field Based Logistics Team. This is a courier/driver position who will make deliveries and pick up medical equipment used during spine surgery. The position coordinates closely with the Operations Team, Development Team, Marketing Team, and Customers. Their principal responsibility is to travel to hospitals and deliver basic medical trays and/or pick up trays. Detailed documentation of servicing activities and inventory transactions is imperative.

Required Skills / Capabilities
  • Completes specialized tasks that frequently require the exchange of detailed technical or sensitive information
  • Works on assignments requiring considerable judgment and initiative. 
  • Understands the implications of work and makes recommendations for solutions
  • Applies expertise as a specialist
  • Uses judgment to identify when deviation from standard practice is required
  • Read maps and route configuration
  • Load, unload, or stack containers, materials, or products
  • Maintain record, reports, and files
  • Implement, maintain and support Quality initiatives
  • Works independently guided by short-term objectives; work requires evaluation and discretion within defined standards
  • Communicate with customers and hospital personnel professionally
  • Communicate with management on a daily basis with regards to operational issues and/or improvements
  • Applicant must have the ability to perform all the above responsibilities with minimal supervision
Education and Experience
  • Requires a high school diploma and a minimum of 2 or more years of related experience
  • Preferred Qualifications: Medical device logistics experience with knowledge on local roadways
  • Valid Driver's license with a good driving record
  • Demonstrated knowledge of principles and methods for moving medical products

title: Packaging & Labeling Project Manager
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

  •       Key stakeholder in defining a new and improved business process to support labeling for implementation to support increased scale of sterile product manufacturing.
  •       Process owner for all Labeling Design and Development activities
  •    Consolidating Labeling Requirements from cross functional stakeholders
  •    Directing label design efforts
  •    Collaborating with cross functional partners to validate Label Designs (outputs) meet Label Requirements (inputs)
  •    Supporting team efforts to release label elements (stock , templates, images, BOMs) into the chosen labeling programs
  •        Serve as point of contact for production label troubleshooting.  Will lead issue triage effort to pull in Subject Matter Experts as appropriate (e.g. IT, SAP material master team, Printer technical support, Label software technical support, Label stock provider, etc.).
  •        Lead remediation effort to merge legacy labels into new labeling processes.  This will require dynamic communication skills to support interaction with multiple contract manufacturers using legacy process, as well as project management skills.
  •        Support of ongoing production for internal manufacturing in Ohio and contract manufacturers within the supply chain.
  •        Support of Distribution, kitting and bulk packaging operation in Memphis.
  •        Establish and maintain read/write access of NiceLabel Control center.
  •        Develop implementation plans for future compliance initiatives that support updates to existing and future labels.
  •        Collaborate with internal Material Master teams to assure SAP tables are updated  sure appropriate translations
  •        Collaborate on label development activities with Packaging Development Engineers on NPI Projects for alpha and commercial launch timelines
  •        Internal Audit - responsible to operate under quality system SOP's and field evidence requests from 2nd and 3rd Party auditors
  •        Collaborate on resolution of Labeling Related Complaints (from customers) or Service Incident Report (from internal distribution channels) as needed
  •        Support negotiations with existing and future contract manufacturers to define operational labeling requirements
  •        Lead continuous improvement efforts to improve efficiencies and reduce operation downtime
  •        Perform duties in compliance with applicable FDA and international regulations as well as standards including, but not limited to, ISO 13485 and 21 CFR Part 820.
Required Skills / Capabilities

  •        Bachelor’s degree or equivalent professional experience
  •  
  •        5+ years experience in regulated industry labeling management
  •        Knowledge of best labeling processes and practices
  •        Effective communication skills with strong confidence to lead project meetings and review boards with groups of cross functional peers, suppliers and NuVasive leadership
  •        Solid understanding of change control fundamentals
  •        Awareness of software validation requirements as it relates to labeling processes
Education and Experience

  •        Proficiency in SAP and Nicelabel is highly desirable
  •        Advanced excel skills for data analysis is highly desirable
  •        Proficiency with Microsoft Office with a strong ability to write procedures and reports
  •        Experience with project management principles and systems (e.g. Microsoft Project) is strongly desired
  •        Prior knowledge of medical device packaging, labeling, labeling management software, UDI and MDR highly desired.
  •        Knowledge of IT systems and infrastructure is preferred

Upto 10% Travel 

Preferably on-site in San Diego

title: Senior Financial Analyst- Research and Development (Partially Remote)
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities

Nuvasive is looking for a Senior Finainical Analyst to partner with our Research and Development (R&D) team to prepare, manage, and direct the allocation of budget for the R&D function. Provides insight into the performance of R&D along with financial support to translate strategy into execution. Reviews and approves recommendations for financial planning and control, providing relevant information to management and cross-functional teams. Responsible for performing month-end close activities, generating financial reporting and KPI data for business reviews, and completing ad hoc analyses.

    • Provides reporting, analysis and interpretation of financial information while recommending courses of action. Key business partner role to the Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
    • Works cross-functionally across multiple locations with Corporate Accounting and other FP&A groups to lead the month-end close process
    • Creates and align KPI’s, automated reporting, and dashboards in support of portfolio recommendations
    • Completes necessary reviews and analyses regarding R&D investments as well as financial reporting processes and output
    • Drives product phase gate reviews to ensure proper KPI’s are met and cross functional support is aligned throughout the product development process
    • Supports R&D leaders in strategic planning and develops monthly executive-level summary packages to illustrate progress against targets
    • Maintains the financial health of the R&D organization
    • Assists in the development of the long-range business plan and build versus buy analyses
    • Performs other duties as assigned
    • Considering candidates located near San Diego, CA or Broomfield, CO
 
Required Skills / Capabilities
    • Outstanding initiative and ability to manage multiple projects
    • Detailed knowledge of financial planning & management (P&L, Balance Sheet and Cash Flows)
    • Proven experience demonstrating leadership and building alignment across cross-functional teams and projects to accomplish desired results
    • Confident in communicating with senior members of management within a global organization
    • Portfolio management experience
    • Ability to build strong working relationships and collaborate with all levels of management
    • Exceptional analytical ability with advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and modeling
    • Strong understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)
#LI-hybrid
Education and Experience
  • Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degree; or 3 years and a Master’s degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience
    • Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance
    • SAP or other large ERP system experience
Travel and/or Physical Requirements

Less than 10%

title: Distribution Coordinator, Singapore
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities
 

Initiates, maintains, and compiles records associated with ordering, receiving, storing, issuing, and shipping materials, supplies, and equipment. Packages and prepares products and merchandise for final shipment and posts weights and shipping charges. Prepares and maintains records of merchandise shipped. Reviews customer orders, examines, stocks and distributes merchandise, products and materials in distribution center

  • Compares nomenclature, stock numbers, and other listed information on packing slips to verify accuracy of purchase orders and shipping orders
  • Compiles and performs data entry tasks to maintain inventory, purchasing, shipping, and other records; uses data sources such as contracts, purchase orders, invoices, requisitions, etc.
  • Verifies inventory computations against physical count of stock and adjusts errors and documents discrepancies with proposed corrective action
  • Compiles and maintains manual or computerized records such as material inventory, in-process production reports, and status of material locations
  • Compiles information on receipt of disbursement of material, equipment, merchandise, or supplies, and computes inventory balance, price, and cost
  • Packages materials and equipment ensuring that shipping documentation is accurate and materials are protected adequately for shipment; determines most efficient and economical routing and mode of transportation
  • Prepares reports such as inventory balance, price and shortages taking necessary actions to reconcile discrepancies in a timely manner
  • Assists developing processes and procedures for inventory, receiving, shipping, and administrative responsibilities to improve cost and efficiencies
  • Perofrms other duties as assigned
   
Required Skills / Capabilities
 
  • Strong proficiency with MS Office software, document management software and ability to navigating the Internet
  • Possesses interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
   
Education and Experience
 
  • Typically requires a mimimum of 1-2 years of related experience
  • High School Diploma or equivalent required
   
Travel and/or Physical Requirements
  • Be able to lift up to 25kgs

title: Operating Room Specialist (Puerto Rico)
description:
Job Summary and Primary Responsibilities
  • Maintain, manage and track consignments and loaner inventory in accounts assigned to cover surgery.
  • Territory case coverage
  • Delivery within 24 hours all documentation required for invoicing post-surgery.
  • Manage customer needs in assigned facilities.
  • Maintain up-to-date customer record books and other records in accordance with Commercial Leader.

  • Required to interact with a computer for extended periods, and communicate with peers and co-workers
  • Regularly required to talk or hear
